subtopics.title: Metaclasses

title: Exception Handling
description: Explore basic to advanced exception handling concepts in Python.

subtopics.title: Exceptions handling basic
subtopics.description: Explains how to catch exception by try-exception-else-finally, Handling Specific Exceptions, and exception chaining and grouping.

subtopics.title: Raising Exceptions (`raise`)
subtopics.description: Explains how to deliberately trigger exceptions using the `raise` keyword for input validation, error signaling, and exception chaining.

subtopics.title: Custom Exceptions
subtopics.description: Covers how to create user-defined exception classes by inheriting from Python's base `Exception` class to build a clear and specific error handling model.

title: File Handling
description: A comprehensive guide to reading from and writing to files in Python. Covers text files, structured data like JSON and CSV, and advanced topics like character encodings and binary file manipulation.

subtopics.title: File Handling Fundamentals (Modern Way)
subtopics.description: Covers the modern, standard way to read and write text files using the `with` statement. Explains file modes, reading methods, and how to use seek() and tell().

subtopics.title: File Handling (Old Manual Method)
subtopics.description: Explains the legacy method of manually using open() and close(). Highlights the dangers of resource leaks and demonstrates why the 'with' statement is superior.

subtopics.title: File Handling: JSON Data
subtopics.description: Explains how to serialize Python objects (like dictionaries) into JSON files and deserialize JSON back into Python objects using the `json` module.

subtopics.title: File Handling: CSV Data
subtopics.description: Covers how to read from and write to CSV files. Explains both list-based (`reader`, `writer`) and dictionary-based (`DictReader`, `DictWriter`) methods.

subtopics.title: Advanced File Handling: Encodings & Binary Files
subtopics.description: Explains the importance of character encoding (`utf-8`) to prevent errors and how to work with non-text files (images, etc.) using binary mode ('rb', 'wb').

title: Modules and Packages
description: A deep dive into how Python organizes code into modules and packages. Covers the basics of importing, namespaces, and explores several essential built-in modules from the standard library.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Python Modules
subtopics.description: Covers the basics of Python modules (a single .py file). Explains how to use `import`, `from...import`, and aliases (`as`) to reuse code and manage namespaces.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Python Packages
subtopics.description: Explains the fundamentals of Python packages, which are directories of modules. Covers the role of `__init__.py` and how packages help organize large projects.

subtopics.title: The `os` Module
subtopics.description: Demonstrates how to interact with the operating system using the `os` module. Covers path manipulation, directory operations (`listdir`, `mkdir`), and environment variables.

subtopics.title: Modern Paths with `pathlib`
subtopics.description: Explains the modern, object-oriented way to handle filesystem paths using the `pathlib` module, which is the recommended alternative to `os.path`.

subtopics.title: The `random` Module
subtopics.description: Covers how to generate pseudo-random numbers and perform random operations using the `random` module. Includes examples for `randint`, `choice`, and `shuffle`.

subtopics.title: Regular Expressions: The `re` Module
subtopics.description: An introduction to regular expressions for pattern matching in strings. Covers the core functions of the `re` module, including `search`, `match`, `findall`, and `sub`.

subtopics.title: The `math` Module
subtopics.description: Explores the built-in `math` module, which provides access to common mathematical functions (`sqrt`, `pow`, `ceil`, `floor`) and constants (`pi`, `e`).

subtopics.title: The `datetime` Module
subtopics.description: Covers how to work with dates, times, and time differences using the `datetime` module. Includes examples for `date`, `time`, `datetime`, and `timedelta` objects.
